snippet: The businessman Sean Quinn has been accused of “bankruptcy tourism” — filing in the location where terms are most favorable — by creditors seeking almost $3.8 billion.
abstract: Belfast judge rejects attempt by businessman Sean Quinn, once considered Ireland's richest man, to declare bankruptcy in Northern Ireland rather than his home country in the Republic of Ireland, where rules are stricter; Quinn has been accused of 'bankruptcy tourism' by creditors seeking to collect almost 3 billion euros ($3.8 billion).
lead_paragraph: The businessman Sean Quinn has been accused of “bankruptcy tourism” — filing in the location where terms are most favorable — by creditors seeking almost $3.8 billion.

headline.seo: Judge Blocks a Bankruptcy in Northern Ireland
headline.main: Belfast Judge Blocks Bankruptcy in Northern Ireland
headline.print_headline: In Belfast, Judge Blocks Bankruptcy Of a Tycoon
